discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct. The Data Analyst should use Download to add a button to the dashboard that allows users to export the dashboard as an image.

questions.question_text:
A Data Analyst is creating a new dashboard.

The analyst needs to add a button to the dashboard that allows users to export the dashboard as an image.

Which type of object should the analyst use?

choices.B: Use dual-axis maps to overlay different layers.
choices.C: Enable the Layer Control in the Map Options.
choices.D: Use the Filter shelf to allow users to filter layers.
choices.A: Add a parameter to toggle layer visibility.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Parameters in Tableau provide direct user control.

questions.question_text:
A Data Analyst is creating a map that includes multiple data layers at country, state, and city levels. Users want to customize their map by turning layers on and off as needed.

How should the analyst provide this functionality?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
LEFT(SPLIT([Order_ID], "_P", 2), 2): eg: Split the Id using '_P' it forms two part C_123 and _PZ_2. from this take the 2nd part and use LEFT function and get first 2 word.

Selected Answer: B
Tested, as well

Selected Answer: B
Tested. The correct answer is B

Selected Answer: B
It asks to change the values of a dimension, therefore you would want to use Aliases. This allows you to look into individual values and change what they are called. 
Renaming would only rename the field.

Selected Answer: B
B. Create aliases
You can create aliases (alternate names) for members in a dimension so that their labels appear differently in the view

Selected Answer: B
one can quickly define an alias for the dimension value. It will be used for the display only. For applying any filter condition on aliased dimension, pls use original value.

comments.content: Rename will rename the dimension name not the dimension value

questions.question_text:
You need to change the values of a dimension without creating a new field.
What should you do?

choices.D: To analyze the distribution of a measure over time
choices.C: To visualize the change in a measure across different regions in a map
choices.A: To display hierarchical data with nested categories
choices.B: To show the correlation between two continuous variables

questions.question_text: When should a Data Analyst use a Treemap in Tableau?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is correct. Visualize parts of a whole, where each rectangle represents a category, and the size/color. Show relationships within hierarchical data
